channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Eynesford recreation ground, Playground needs maintenance, 8th July
item.description:
The big swings do not swing properly and need oiling. The little train needs attention also as the wheel doesn't turn easily, again needs oiling. The safety mat in several places is raising and can be lifted easily, but the safety mat of the big swings is also slippery and in wet or icing conditions is a slipping hazard. Unfortunately, the site would not upload my pictures.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eynsford Close, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown tree damaging our property, 8th July
item.description:
This tree has got too big , the roots are damaging our drive , front garden , our wall and house. We have continual problems with this tree . It is so high it is now tangled up with the phone line wires . This has been an ongoing problem as the tree grows bigger and bigger. Work that was said would be done to the roots in the past was never carried out .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lovelace Avenue, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Near 36 Goodge Street, W1T 2QN, 8th July
item.description:
Dear Sir/Madam, I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to report an issue concerning a drainage or manhole problem outside our building, located at 36 Goodge Street, W1T 2QN. There appears to be a manhole (or possibly a drain) near the entrance, directly outside the building. During heavy rainfall, it consistently overflows, causing water to leak into the interior of the building We kindly request that the council investigate this matter as soon as possible and take appropriate action to prevent further leakage and damage. Please let me know if you need further information. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Goodge Street, Fitzrovia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Absolutely disgusting path, 8th July
item.description:
The path outside Bexleyheath train station towards dartford as you exit the station and turn right has been neglected for months…dogs poo/bags, litter overgrown weeds..makes it difficult to walk when there’s other people walking the opposite way.. needs urgent action
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avenue Road, Welling, London
